1.0.gmnotes: Custom Counters v1.0 This library contains a drop-in macro called 'Custom Counters' that can be used from anywhere in a campaign to track any kind of simple resources, a lot like using glass counters during a tabletop game. To get started, select the token you which to update with custom counters, and click on the macro button. You can add, increment/decrement, and edit counters from the list. You can additionally place the 'Show Counters' button in the Campaign, GM, or any Token macro panel to call the macro remotely. Options There are a few options you can set by changing their definitions in the macro. If you aren't using the Custom Counters macro by reference, it is recommended to do this before copying the macro anywhere in your campaign. vPropertyName: This is the name of the Token Property the macro stores custom counter JSON data inside of. Change this if you already use 'CustomCounters' as a property name or want to use a different name. You can also add this as a defined token property to edit counters directly from the Edit Token dialog. vCounterCategories: This is a list of categories for counters. The default list was made to fit well for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition, but you can customize it for any game system. vCounterTypeList: This is a list of reset types. The 'Keys' repesent the option text in the Add/Edit counter dialog box, and the value is the actual counter type that is recorded on the token. The default counter type is an empty string/null value which creates a simple counter without a maximum value. All others create a maximum value. Getting Fancy You can copy-past the 'Adjust Counter' macro to make your own special counte radjustment macros, or call it from another macro to increment the counters. You can use Counter Types to reset or affect a counter based on a condition in another macro. For instance, you can have a 'Short Rest' macro that looks for any counters with 'Short Rest' as the counter type and then resets the value to maximum. You can see the 'Short Rest' and 'Long Rest' macros in my Simple 5e library for examples. To change the counter values programmatically, you will need to write macros using JSON. The data format is very simple array of objects with up to 5 keys: 'name', 'category', 'value', and optionally 'max' and 'type'. There are no property dependencies in these macros that aren't configurable, and the core macro in particular is extremely portable and will work from any macro panel. Have Fun!

macros.tooltip:
<html><body style="width:200px">
Add, Edit, and Remove custom counters on a token.
<hr>
Configure this macro to fit your game, then place on the Campaign or GM panel. You can also place onto tokens or call from another token macro using the [macro():] roll option.
</body></html>

macros.label: Adjust Counter
macros.command: [h, code: { " " }] [h: ""] [h: vCounterName = ""] [h: vCounterCost = 0] [h: ""] [h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")] [h: assert(if(vCounterName == "", 0, 1), "No CounterName set.", 0)] [h: ""] [h: ""] [h: vCustomCounterMacro = "Custom Counters@Lib:CustomCounters"] [h: vPropertyName = "CustomCounters"] [h: ""] [h: vCustomCounters = getProperty(vPropertyName)] [h: vCounter = json.get(json.path.read(vCustomCounters, '.[?(@.name == "' + vCounterName + '")]'), 0)] [h: vCounterIndex = json.indexOf(vCustomCounters, vCounter)] [h: vCounterValue = json.get(vCounter, "value")] [h: vCounterMax = json.get(vCounter, "max")] [h: vNewCounterValue = vCounterValue - vCounterCost] [h: vMsg = ""] [h, if(vNewCounterValue < 0), code: { [h, if(vCounterMax != ""): vCounterMax = "/" + vCounterMax] [vMsg = token.name + " can't " + if(vCounterCost > 0, "spend", "gain") + " " + floor(math.abs(vCounterCost)) + " " + vCounterName + " (" + vCounterValue + vCounterMax + ")."] };{ [if(isNumber(vCounterMax)), code: { [if(vNewCounterValue > vCounterMax): vNewCounterValue = vCounterMax] [vCounterMax = "/" + vCounterMax] };{}] [vCounter = json.set(vCounter, "value", vNewCounterValue)] [vCustomCounters = json.set(vCustomCounters, vCounterIndex, vCounter)] [setProperty(vPropertyName, vCustomCounters)] [if(vCustomCounterMacro != "" && isFrameVisible("Custom Counters")), code: { [macro(vCustomCounterMacro):""] };{}] [if(vCounterValue != vNewCounterValue) : vMsg = token.name + " adjusted counter " + vCounterName + " from " + vCounterValue + " to " + vNewCounterValue + vCounterMax + "."; vMsg = token.name + " can't " + if(vCounterCost > 0, "spend", "gain") + " " + floor(math.abs(vCounterCost)) + " " + vCounterName + " (" + vCounterValue + vCounterMax + ")."] }] [h, if(vMsg != ""): broadcast(vMsg)]
macros.tooltip:
<html><body style="width:200px">
Adjusts a counter by a given cost.
<hr>
Meant to be copied and edited, or called from other macros with a JSON object with the values 'CounterName' and 'CounterCost'. Note that a negative cost will ADD to the counter up to the counter's maximum (if any).
</html>

macros.command:
[h, code: {
	[h: vPropsJSON = "{}"]
	[h, foreach(vProp, getPropertyNamesRaw(), ""): 
	vPropsJSON = json.set(vPropsJSON, vProp, getRawProperty(vProp))]

	[h: vMacrosJSON = ""]
	[h, foreach(vLabel, getMacros("json"), ""), code: {
    [foreach(vIndex, getMacroIndexes(vLabel), ""):
	  	vMacrosJSON = json.append(vMacrosJSON, getMacroProps(vIndex, "json"))]
	}]
	
	[h: vISOTime     = json.get(getInfo("Client"), "isoTimeDate")]
	[h: vTimeVersion = "0.0." + listget(replace(vISOTime, "[- :T]", ""), 0, ".")]
	
	[h: vLibVersion = getLibProperty("libVersion")]
	[h, if(vLibversion == ""):
		vLibVersion = vTimeVersion]
	[h: vJSON = json.set("{}", getName(), json.set("{}", vLibVersion,
		json.set("{}",
		"mtversion" , json.get(getInfo("client"), "version"),
		"notes"		, getNotes(),
		"gmnotes"	, getGMNotes(),
		"properties", vPropsJSON,
		"macros"	, vMacrosJSON)))]
}]

macros.label: OverlayPositionCSS
SampleOverlayJS
macros.command:
<script>
function toggleOverlay(cssQuery) {
	var toggles = document.querySelectorAll(cssQuery);
  for (let i = 0; i < toggles.length; i++) {
  	toggles[i].classList.toggle('hidden');
  }  
}

function addWidget() {
	let newDiv = document.getElementById("OVERLAY-004").cloneNode(true);
  let widgets = document.querySelector(".overlay__flex-content");
  widgets.appendChild(newDiv);
}

function removeWidget(minChildren) {
  minChildren = typeof minChildren !== 'undefined' ? minChildren : 2;
	let widgets = document.querySelector(".overlay__flex-content");
  if(widgets.children.length > minChildren) {
  	widgets.removeChild(widgets.lastChild);
  }
}

toggleOverlay(".example:not([data-stickaround])");
removeWidget();
</script>

macros.tooltip: Included to work with Reverend's Smart Doors

0.2.notes:
SimpleDoors is a basic approach to doors in MapTool which let the GM quickly toggle the visible state of a cell edge or nearby drawing named 'Door' to block or grant players vision across a line. Users can click directly on the door icon, toggling its state with a handy visual icon. 


Installation: 
- Place the Lib:SimpleDoors library on your staging or library map.
- Copy the 'Create Door' macro to your Campaign or GM macros. 

Creating doors: 
- Disable the 'SimpleDoor' handler overlay in the Window -> Overlays menu.
- Ensure the map you are on has a SQUARE grid type.
- Create and place doors on edges you wish to behave as doors.
   - Doors automaticall toggle a line of VBL on the edge they are on. 
   - Alternatively, you can draw custom doors:
      - Draw a line (exactly 2 points) on any layer. The 'Hidden' layer is recommended. 
      - Right click your new line drawing in the Draw Explorer, click 'Set Name', and set the name to 'Door'.
      - Center your Door icon within half a cell of the center of your 'Door' line.
      - You can have as many 'Door' lines as you want on your map.

Using doors:
- Enable the 'SimpleDoor Handler' overlay in the Window -> Overlays menu.
- Simple click on doors. They must be on the 'Token' layer if you want players to be able to toggle them.
- If the server lets players auto-reveal on movement, SimpleDoors will try to expose visible area when players open doors.


Notes:
- SimpleDoors do not include any movement blocking features, but can work with AI Pathfinding if you check the 'Treat VBL as MBL' option by the AI button in the interaction tools.

macros.label: checkDoors
macros.command:
[h: vMode = ""]
[h: vLastSelection = ""]
[h: vDoorTokens = ""]

[h: vToggleDoor = 0]
[h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")]

[h, if(vMode != "Initialize"), code: {
	[foreach(vToken, getTokens()), if(getGMName(vToken) == "SimpleDoor"):
		vDoorTokens = listAppend(vDoorTokens, vToken)]
	[abort(listCount(vDoorTokens))]
}]

[h, if(vMode == "checkDoor"), code: {
	[vToken = getSelected()]
	[if(listContains(vDoorTokens, vToken)), code: {
		[vToggleDoor = 1]
		[vDoorToken = vToken]
	};{}]
};{}]

[h, if(vToggleDoor), code: {
	[switchToken(vDoorToken)]
	[vAutoReveal = json.get(getInfo("server"), "auto reveal on movement")]

	[h: vPointsJSON = simpleDoors.getSimpleDoorPoints()]
	
	[h: vDoorInfo	= getGMNotes()]
	[h: vDoorStatus = json.get(vDoorInfo, "Status")]
	
	[h, if(vDoorStatus == "Open"), code: {
		[setGMNotes(json.set(vDoorInfo, "Status", "Closed"))]
		[setTokenPortrait(getTokenImage())]
		[setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())]	
		[setTokenHandout(getTokenPortrait())]
		[setTokenPortrait("")]
		[simpleDoors.lineVBL("draw", vPointsJSON)]
	};{
		[setGMNotes(json.set(vDoorInfo, "Status", "Open"))]
		[setTokenPortrait(getTokenImage())]
		[setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())]	
		[setTokenHandout(getTokenPortrait())]
		[setTokenPortrait("")]
		[simpleDoors.lineVBL("erase", vPointsJSON)]
	}]

	[if(vAutoReveal && !isGM()): exposeAllOwnedArea()]
		
	[if(vLastSelection == ""):
		deselectTokens();
		selectTokens(vLastSelection, 0, ",")]
};{}]

[h: vThisMacro = getMacroName() + "@" + getMacroLocation())]
[overlay("SimpleDoor Handler"): {

macros.label: createDoor
macros.command: [h: vMode = "createDoor"] [h: vLibMap = json.get(getLibProperty("libSettings", getMacroLocation()), "LibMap")] [h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")] [h, if(vMode == "createDoor"), code: { [vThisMacro = getMacroName() + "@" + getMacroLocation()] [vViewCenterXY = getViewCenter(0, "json")] [vNewDoorX = json.get(vViewCenterXY, "centerX")] [vNewDoorY = json.get(vViewCenterXY, "centerY")] [vUpdates = json.set("{}", "x", vNewDoorX, "y", vNewDoorY, "layer", "Token", "gmName", "SimpleDoor", "name", "Door")] [vNewDoor = copyToken(getMacroLocation(), 1, vLibMap, vUpdates)] [setSize("Diminutive", vNewDoor)] [setTokenImage(getTokenHandout("", vNewDoor), vNewDoor)] [setTokenHandout(getTokenPortrait("", vNewDoor), vNewDoor)] [setTokenPortrait("", vNewDoor)] [setNotes("", vNewDoor)] [setGMNotes(json.set("{}", "Status", "Open"), vNewDoor)] [setAlwaysVisible(1, vNewDoor)] [setTokenOpacity(0.75, vNewDoor)] [setTokenSnapToGrid(0, vNewDoor)] [vMacroList = getMacros("json", vNewDoor)] [foreach(vMacro, vMacroList, ""): removeMacro(number(getMacroIndexes(vMacro, "", vNewDoor)), vNewDoor)] [broadcast("New Door created! " + macroLink("Click for usage help", "showHelp@" + getMacroLocation()) + ".", "gm")] }]
macros.tooltip: This macro creates a SimpleDoor in the middle of the screen.

macros.label: Control Panel
macros.command:
[h: "<!-- Set Default Arguments -->"]
[h: vSettingsToChange = "libSettings"]

[h: "<!-- Get Arguments -->"]
[h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")]

[h: "<!-- Get Library Data -->"]
[h: vLibSettingsRaw = getLibProperty(vSettingsToChange))]

[h: "<!-- Set Variables -->"]
[h: vLibSettings = vLibSettingsRaw]
[h: vLibStrProps = "{}"]
[h: vLibStrPropsInput = ""]

[h: "<!-- Separate Property Lists from Single Values -->"]
[h, foreach(vKey, vLibSettingsRaw, ""), code: {
	[vValue = json.get(vLibSettingsRaw, vKey)]
	[vIsValueStrProp = countStrProp(string(vValue))]
	[if(vIsValueStrProp > 0), code: {
		[vLibStrProps = json.set(vLibStrProps, vKey, vValue)]
		[vLibStrPropsInput = listAppend(vLibStrPropsInput, "vLibSetting." + vKey + "|" + vValue + "|" + vSettingsToChange + "." + vKey + "|PROPS|SPAN=TRUE SETVARS=UNSUFFIXED", "##")]
		[vLibSettings = json.remove(vLibSettings, vKey)]
	}]
}]

[h: "<!-- Display Input Dialog -->"]
[h: "<!-- Must convert properties from JSON to String Property Lists and back -->"]
[h: vLibSettings = json.toStrProp(vLibSettings)]
[h: abort(input( "vLibSettings | " + vLibSettings + " | " + token.name + " - " + vSettingsToChange +"| PROPS | SPAN=TRUE SETVARS=UNSUFFIXED", vLibStrPropsInput))]

[h: vLibSettings = json.fromStrProp(vLibSettings)]

[h: "<!-- Recombine String Property List values into JSON and add to vLibSettings -->"]
[h, foreach(vKey, vLibStrProps, ""), code: {	
	[eval("vValue = vLibSetting." + vKey)]
	[vLibSettings = json.set(vLibSettings, vKey, vValue)]
}]

[h: "<!-- Finally, write vLibSettings back to token properties -->"]
[h: setLibProperty(vSettingsToChange, vLibSettings))]

Token defaults and settings have been updated current token name, token ID, and map.", getPlayerName())]

macros.label: showHelp
macros.command:
[h: vMsg = "Using SimpleDoors
* Uncheck the SimpleDoor Handler from the Window -> Overlays menu to move Doors around. Re-enable it to use Doors in play.
* Place a door along the edge whose VBL you want to toggle. If you wish, you can edit the Door token and click the Config tab, and in the layout editor place the lock image along the appropriate edge.
* Your door will not block vision until you close it.
* To toggle VBL of a door that is not a grid edge, draw a 2-point line with the Drawing tool (Hidden layer is OK) and set the drawing's name to 'Door' if you want a custom VBL door. Place the Door token within half a grid cell of the center of the line and it will automattically toggle VBL over the line when opened/closed. * You can name your door as you wish, such as 'Iron Door' or 'Treasure chest'. Just leave the 'GM Name' equal to 'SimpleDoor'."] [h: broadcast(vMsg, "gm")]
macros.tooltip: Basic usage help.

macros.label: findClosestLine
macros.command:
[h: vToken = currentToken()]
[h, if(argCount() > 0): vToken = arg(0)]
[h: vDoorIds = findDrawings(getCurrentMapName(), "Door")]
[h: vXmid                = ""]
[h: vYmid                = ""]
[h: vClosestDoorDistance = ""]
[h: vClosestDoorPoints   = ""]
[h, foreach(vDoorId, vDoorIds, ""), code: {
	[vPoints = json.get(getDrawingInfo(getCurrentMapName(), vDoorId), "path")]
	[if(json.length(vPoints) == 2), code: {
		[vX1 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 0), "x")]
		[vX2 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 1), "x")]
		[vY1 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 0), "y")]
		[vY2 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 1), "y")]
		[vXmid = floor((vX1 + vX2) / 2)]
		[vYmid = floor((vY1 + vY2) / 2)]
		[vXtoken = getTokenX(1, vToken) + (getTokenWidth(vToken)  / 2)]
		[vYtoken = getTokenY(1, vToken) + (getTokenHeight(vToken) / 2)]
		[vDeltaX = vXmid - vXtoken]
		[vDeltaY = vYmid - vYtoken]
		[vDoorDistance = math.hypot(vDeltaX, vDeltaY)]
		[if(vClosestDoorDistance == ""): 
			vClosestDoorDistance =  vDoorDistance]
		[if(vClosestDoorDistance >= vDoorDistance):
			vClosestDoorPoints = vPoints]
		[if(vClosestDoorDistance >= vDoorDistance):
			vClosestDoorDistance = vDoorDistance]		
	}]
}]

[h: "<!-- Build and return JSON, which has both the distance and the points JSON -->"]
[h: vReturnJSON = json.set("{}", "distance", vClosestDoorDistance, "points", vClosestDoorPoints)]
[h: return(0, vReturnJSON)]

macros.label: findClosestGridEdge
macros.command: [h: ""] [h: vMapInfo = getInfo("map")] [h: vCellSize = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.size")] [h: vGridType = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.type")] [h: vXOffset = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.['x offset']")] [h: vYOffset = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.['y offset']")] [h, if(vGridType != "Square"): log.error("Warning: SimpleDoors are only designed to work on maps with SQUARE grids!", "gm")] [h: ""] [h: vX = math.floor(getTokenX() + (getTokenWidth() / 2))] [h: vY = math.floor(getTokenY() + (getTokenHeight() / 2))] [h, if(vX >= 0): vXModCellSize = math.mod(vX, vCellSize); vXModCellSize = vCellSize - math.abs(math.mod(vX, vCellSize))] [h, if(vY >= 0): vYModCellSize = math.mod(vY, vCellSize); vYModCellSize = vCellSize - math.abs(math.mod(vY, vCellSize))] [h: vLeftEdgeX = vX - vXModCellSize + vXOffset] [h: vTopEdgeY = vY - vYModCellSize + vYOffset] [h: vRightEdgeX = vLeftEdgeX + vCellSize] [h: vBottomEdgeY = vTopEdgeY + vCellSize] [h: ""] [h: vTopEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY))] [h: vRightEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vBottomEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vLeftEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vEdges = json.append("", vTopEdge, vRightEdge, vBottomEdge, vLeftEdge)] [h: ""] [h: vEdgeDistances = ""] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vY - vTopEdgeY))] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vX - vRightEdgeX))] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vY - vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vX - vLeftEdgeX))] [h: ""] [h: vClosestEdgeDistance = math.listMin(vEdgeDistances)] [h: vClosestEdgeIndex = listFind(vEdgeDistances, vClosestEdgeDistance)] [h: vClosestEdgeJSON = json.get(vEdges, vClosestEdgeIndex)] [h: ""] [h: vReturnJSON = json.set("{}", "distance", vClosestEdgeDistance, "points", vClosestEdgeJSON)] [h: return(0, vReturnJSON)]

macros.label: lineVBL
macros.command:
[h: vErrorMsg = 
	getMacroName() + " error: requires a single JSON array of 2 JSON point objects. Example: [{'x':0, 'y':0}, {'x':100,'y':0}]"]

[h, if(argCount() != 2): 		      assert(0, vErrorMsg)]
[h: vVBLPoints = arg(1)]
[h, if(json.type(vVBLPoints) != "ARRAY" || json.length(vVBLPoints) != 2): assert(0, vErrorMsg)]

[h: vVBLShape   = json.set("{}", "shape", "polygon", "close", 0, "points", vVBLPoints)]
[h: vVBLJSON    = json.append("", vVBLShape)]

[h: vMode = lower(arg(0))]
[h, if(vMode == "draw"):  drawVBL(vVBLJSON)]
[h, if(vMode == "erase"): eraseVBL(vVBLJSON)]

macros.label: getSimpleDoorPoints
macros.command: [h: ""] [h: vMapInfo = getInfo("map")] [h: vCellSize = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.size")] [h: vGridType = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.type")] [h, if(vGridType != "Square"): log.error("Warning: SimpleDoors are only designed to work on maps with SQUARE grids!", "gm")] [h: ""] [h: vToken = currentToken()] [h, if(argCount() > 0): vToken = arg(0)] [h: vClosestEdge = simpleDoors.findClosestGridEdge()] [h: vClosestLine = simpleDoors.findClosestLine()] [h: vLineDistance = json.get(vClosestLine, "distance")] [h, if(vLineDistance != ""), code: { [if(vLineDistance <= vCellSize / 2): vClosestPoints = json.get(vClosestLine, "points"); vClosestPoints = json.get(vClosestEdge, "points")] };{ [vClosestPoints = json.get(vClosestEdge, "points")] }] [h: return(0, vClosestPoints)]

macros.label: exportLibJSON
macros.command:
[h, code: {
	[h: vPropsJSON = "{}"]
	[h, foreach(vProp, getPropertyNamesRaw(), ""): 
	vPropsJSON = json.set(vPropsJSON, vProp, getRawProperty(vProp))]

	[h: vMacrosJSON = ""]
	[h, foreach(vLabel, getMacros("json"), ""), code: {
    [foreach(vIndex, getMacroIndexes(vLabel), ""):
	  	vMacrosJSON = json.append(vMacrosJSON, getMacroProps(vIndex, "json"))]
	}]
	
	[h: vISOTime     = json.get(getInfo("Client"), "isoTimeDate")]
	[h: vTimeVersion = "0.0." + listget(replace(vISOTime, "[- :T]", ""), 0, ".")]
	
	[h: vLibVersion = getLibProperty("libVersion")]
	[h, if(vLibversion == ""):
		vLibVersion = vTimeVersion]
	[h: vJSON = json.set("{}", getName(), json.set("{}", vLibVersion,
		json.set("{}",
		"mtversion" , json.get(getInfo("client"), "version"),
		"notes"		, getNotes(),
		"gmnotes"	, getGMNotes(),
		"properties", vPropsJSON,
		"macros"	, vMacrosJSON)))]
}]

<html>

macros.tooltip: Displays Name/GM Name/Label, Notes, Properties, and Macros to a single JSON.

1.0.gmnotes: Custom Counters v1.0 This library contains a drop-in macro called 'Custom Counters' that can be used from anywhere in a campaign to track any kind of simple resources, a lot like using glass counters during a tabletop game. To get started, select the token you which to update with custom counters, and click on the macro button. You can add, increment/decrement, and edit counters from the list. You can additionally place the 'Show Counters' button in the Campaign, GM, or any Token macro panel to call the macro remotely. Options There are a few options you can set by changing their definitions in the macro. If you aren't using the Custom Counters macro by reference, it is recommended to do this before copying the macro anywhere in your campaign. vPropertyName: This is the name of the Token Property the macro stores custom counter JSON data inside of. Change this if you already use 'CustomCounters' as a property name or want to use a different name. You can also add this as a defined token property to edit counters directly from the Edit Token dialog. vCounterCategories: This is a list of categories for counters. The default list was made to fit well for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition, but you can customize it for any game system. vCounterTypeList: This is a list of reset types. The 'Keys' repesent the option text in the Add/Edit counter dialog box, and the value is the actual counter type that is recorded on the token. The default counter type is an empty string/null value which creates a simple counter without a maximum value. All others create a maximum value. Getting Fancy You can copy-past the 'Adjust Counter' macro to make your own special counte radjustment macros, or call it from another macro to increment the counters. You can use Counter Types to reset or affect a counter based on a condition in another macro. For instance, you can have a 'Short Rest' macro that looks for any counters with 'Short Rest' as the counter type and then resets the value to maximum. You can see the 'Short Rest' and 'Long Rest' macros in my Simple 5e library for examples. To change the counter values programmatically, you will need to write macros using JSON. The data format is very simple array of objects with up to 5 keys: 'name', 'category', 'value', and optionally 'max' and 'type'. There are no property dependencies in these macros that aren't configurable, and the core macro in particular is extremely portable and will work from any macro panel. Have Fun!

macros.command:
<script>
function toggleOverlay(cssQuery) {
	var toggles = document.querySelectorAll(cssQuery);
  for (let i = 0; i < toggles.length; i++) {
  	toggles[i].classList.toggle('hidden');
  }  
}

function addWidget() {
	let newDiv = document.getElementById("OVERLAY-004").cloneNode(true);
  let widgets = document.querySelector(".overlay__flex-content");
  widgets.appendChild(newDiv);
}

function removeWidget(minChildren) {
  minChildren = typeof minChildren !== 'undefined' ? minChildren : 2;
	let widgets = document.querySelector(".overlay__flex-content");
  if(widgets.children.length > minChildren) {
  	widgets.removeChild(widgets.lastChild);
  }
}

toggleOverlay(".example:not([data-stickaround])");
removeWidget();
</script>

0.2.notes:
SimpleDoors is a basic approach to doors in MapTool which let the GM quickly toggle the visible state of a cell edge or nearby drawing named 'Door' to block or grant players vision across a line. Users can click directly on the door icon, toggling its state with a handy visual icon. 


Installation: 
- Place the Lib:SimpleDoors library on your staging or library map.
- Copy the 'Create Door' macro to your Campaign or GM macros. 

Creating doors: 
- Disable the 'SimpleDoor' handler overlay in the Window -> Overlays menu.
- Ensure the map you are on has a SQUARE grid type.
- Create and place doors on edges you wish to behave as doors.
   - Doors automaticall toggle a line of VBL on the edge they are on. 
   - Alternatively, you can draw custom doors:
      - Draw a line (exactly 2 points) on any layer. The 'Hidden' layer is recommended. 
      - Right click your new line drawing in the Draw Explorer, click 'Set Name', and set the name to 'Door'.
      - Center your Door icon within half a cell of the center of your 'Door' line.
      - You can have as many 'Door' lines as you want on your map.

Using doors:
- Enable the 'SimpleDoor Handler' overlay in the Window -> Overlays menu.
- Simple click on doors. They must be on the 'Token' layer if you want players to be able to toggle them.
- If the server lets players auto-reveal on movement, SimpleDoors will try to expose visible area when players open doors.


Notes:
- SimpleDoors do not include any movement blocking features, but can work with AI Pathfinding if you check the 'Treat VBL as MBL' option by the AI button in the interaction tools.

macros.label: checkDoors
macros.command:
[h: vMode = ""]
[h: vLastSelection = ""]
[h: vDoorTokens = ""]

[h: vToggleDoor = 0]
[h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")]

[h, if(vMode != "Initialize"), code: {
	[foreach(vToken, getTokens()), if(getGMName(vToken) == "SimpleDoor"):
		vDoorTokens = listAppend(vDoorTokens, vToken)]
	[abort(listCount(vDoorTokens))]
}]

[h, if(vMode == "checkDoor"), code: {
	[vToken = getSelected()]
	[if(listContains(vDoorTokens, vToken)), code: {
		[vToggleDoor = 1]
		[vDoorToken = vToken]
	};{}]
};{}]

[h, if(vToggleDoor), code: {
	[switchToken(vDoorToken)]
	[vAutoReveal = json.get(getInfo("server"), "auto reveal on movement")]

	[h: vPointsJSON = simpleDoors.getSimpleDoorPoints()]
	
	[h: vDoorInfo	= getGMNotes()]
	[h: vDoorStatus = json.get(vDoorInfo, "Status")]
	
	[h, if(vDoorStatus == "Open"), code: {
		[setGMNotes(json.set(vDoorInfo, "Status", "Closed"))]
		[setTokenPortrait(getTokenImage())]
		[setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())]	
		[setTokenHandout(getTokenPortrait())]
		[setTokenPortrait("")]
		[simpleDoors.lineVBL("draw", vPointsJSON)]
	};{
		[setGMNotes(json.set(vDoorInfo, "Status", "Open"))]
		[setTokenPortrait(getTokenImage())]
		[setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())]	
		[setTokenHandout(getTokenPortrait())]
		[setTokenPortrait("")]
		[simpleDoors.lineVBL("erase", vPointsJSON)]
	}]

	[if(vAutoReveal && !isGM()): exposeAllOwnedArea()]
		
	[if(vLastSelection == ""):
		deselectTokens();
		selectTokens(vLastSelection, 0, ",")]
};{}]

[h: vThisMacro = getMacroName() + "@" + getMacroLocation())]
[overlay("SimpleDoor Handler"): {
<html>
<head>
	<link rel='onChangeSelection' type='macro' href='[r: macroLinkText(vThisMacro, "none", json.set("{}", "Mode", "checkDoor", "LastSelection", getSelected()))]'>
</head>
</html>
}]

macros.command: [h: vMode = "createDoor"] [h: vLibMap = json.get(getLibProperty("libSettings", getMacroLocation()), "LibMap")] [h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")] [h, if(vMode == "createDoor"), code: { [vThisMacro = getMacroName() + "@" + getMacroLocation()] [vViewCenterXY = getViewCenter(0, "json")] [vNewDoorX = json.get(vViewCenterXY, "centerX")] [vNewDoorY = json.get(vViewCenterXY, "centerY")] [vUpdates = json.set("{}", "x", vNewDoorX, "y", vNewDoorY, "layer", "Token", "gmName", "SimpleDoor", "name", "Door")] [vNewDoor = copyToken(getMacroLocation(), 1, vLibMap, vUpdates)] [setSize("Diminutive", vNewDoor)] [setTokenImage(getTokenHandout("", vNewDoor), vNewDoor)] [setTokenHandout(getTokenPortrait("", vNewDoor), vNewDoor)] [setTokenPortrait("", vNewDoor)] [setNotes("", vNewDoor)] [setGMNotes(json.set("{}", "Status", "Open"), vNewDoor)] [setAlwaysVisible(1, vNewDoor)] [setTokenOpacity(0.75, vNewDoor)] [setTokenSnapToGrid(0, vNewDoor)] [vMacroList = getMacros("json", vNewDoor)] [foreach(vMacro, vMacroList, ""): removeMacro(number(getMacroIndexes(vMacro, "", vNewDoor)), vNewDoor)] [broadcast("New Door created! " + macroLink("Click for usage help", "showHelp@" + getMacroLocation()) + ".", "gm")] }]

macros.label: Control Panel
macros.command:
[h: "<!-- Set Default Arguments -->"]
[h: vSettingsToChange = "libSettings"]

[h: "<!-- Get Arguments -->"]
[h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")]

[h: "<!-- Get Library Data -->"]
[h: vLibSettingsRaw = getLibProperty(vSettingsToChange))]

[h: "<!-- Set Variables -->"]
[h: vLibSettings = vLibSettingsRaw]
[h: vLibStrProps = "{}"]
[h: vLibStrPropsInput = ""]

[h: "<!-- Separate Property Lists from Single Values -->"]
[h, foreach(vKey, vLibSettingsRaw, ""), code: {
	[vValue = json.get(vLibSettingsRaw, vKey)]
	[vIsValueStrProp = countStrProp(string(vValue))]
	[if(vIsValueStrProp > 0), code: {
		[vLibStrProps = json.set(vLibStrProps, vKey, vValue)]
		[vLibStrPropsInput = listAppend(vLibStrPropsInput, "vLibSetting." + vKey + "|" + vValue + "|" + vSettingsToChange + "." + vKey + "|PROPS|SPAN=TRUE SETVARS=UNSUFFIXED", "##")]
		[vLibSettings = json.remove(vLibSettings, vKey)]
	}]
}]

[h: "<!-- Display Input Dialog -->"]
[h: "<!-- Must convert properties from JSON to String Property Lists and back -->"]
[h: vLibSettings = json.toStrProp(vLibSettings)]
[h: abort(input( "vLibSettings | " + vLibSettings + " | " + token.name + " - " + vSettingsToChange +"| PROPS | SPAN=TRUE SETVARS=UNSUFFIXED", vLibStrPropsInput))]

[h: vLibSettings = json.fromStrProp(vLibSettings)]

[h: "<!-- Recombine String Property List values into JSON and add to vLibSettings -->"]
[h, foreach(vKey, vLibStrProps, ""), code: {	
	[eval("vValue = vLibSetting." + vKey)]
	[vLibSettings = json.set(vLibSettings, vKey, vValue)]
}]

[h: "<!-- Finally, write vLibSettings back to token properties -->"]
[h: setLibProperty(vSettingsToChange, vLibSettings))]

macros.label: showHelp
macros.command:
[h: vMsg = "Using SimpleDoors
* Uncheck the SimpleDoor Handler from the Window -> Overlays menu to move Doors around. Re-enable it to use Doors in play.
* Place a door along the edge whose VBL you want to toggle. If you wish, you can edit the Door token and click the Config tab, and in the layout editor place the lock image along the appropriate edge.
* Your door will not block vision until you close it.
* To toggle VBL of a door that is not a grid edge, draw a 2-point line with the Drawing tool (Hidden layer is OK) and set the drawing's name to 'Door' if you want a custom VBL door. Place the Door token within half a grid cell of the center of the line and it will automattically toggle VBL over the line when opened/closed. * You can name your door as you wish, such as 'Iron Door' or 'Treasure chest'. Just leave the 'GM Name' equal to 'SimpleDoor'."] [h: broadcast(vMsg, "gm")]
macros.tooltip: Basic usage help.

macros.label: findClosestLine
macros.command:
[h: vToken = currentToken()]
[h, if(argCount() > 0): vToken = arg(0)]
[h: vDoorIds = findDrawings(getCurrentMapName(), "Door")]
[h: vXmid                = ""]
[h: vYmid                = ""]
[h: vClosestDoorDistance = ""]
[h: vClosestDoorPoints   = ""]
[h, foreach(vDoorId, vDoorIds, ""), code: {
	[vPoints = json.get(getDrawingInfo(getCurrentMapName(), vDoorId), "path")]
	[if(json.length(vPoints) == 2), code: {
		[vX1 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 0), "x")]
		[vX2 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 1), "x")]
		[vY1 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 0), "y")]
		[vY2 = json.get(json.get(vPoints, 1), "y")]
		[vXmid = floor((vX1 + vX2) / 2)]
		[vYmid = floor((vY1 + vY2) / 2)]
		[vXtoken = getTokenX(1, vToken) + (getTokenWidth(vToken)  / 2)]
		[vYtoken = getTokenY(1, vToken) + (getTokenHeight(vToken) / 2)]
		[vDeltaX = vXmid - vXtoken]
		[vDeltaY = vYmid - vYtoken]
		[vDoorDistance = math.hypot(vDeltaX, vDeltaY)]
		[if(vClosestDoorDistance == ""): 
			vClosestDoorDistance =  vDoorDistance]
		[if(vClosestDoorDistance >= vDoorDistance):
			vClosestDoorPoints = vPoints]
		[if(vClosestDoorDistance >= vDoorDistance):
			vClosestDoorDistance = vDoorDistance]		
	}]
}]

[h: "<!-- Build and return JSON, which has both the distance and the points JSON -->"]
[h: vReturnJSON = json.set("{}", "distance", vClosestDoorDistance, "points", vClosestDoorPoints)]
[h: return(0, vReturnJSON)]

macros.label: findClosestGridEdge
macros.command: [h: ""] [h: vMapInfo = getInfo("map")] [h: vCellSize = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.size")] [h: vGridType = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.type")] [h: vXOffset = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.['x offset']")] [h: vYOffset = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.['y offset']")] [h, if(vGridType != "Square"): log.error("Warning: SimpleDoors are only designed to work on maps with SQUARE grids!", "gm")] [h: ""] [h: vX = math.floor(getTokenX() + (getTokenWidth() / 2))] [h: vY = math.floor(getTokenY() + (getTokenHeight() / 2))] [h, if(vX >= 0): vXModCellSize = math.mod(vX, vCellSize); vXModCellSize = vCellSize - math.abs(math.mod(vX, vCellSize))] [h, if(vY >= 0): vYModCellSize = math.mod(vY, vCellSize); vYModCellSize = vCellSize - math.abs(math.mod(vY, vCellSize))] [h: vLeftEdgeX = vX - vXModCellSize + vXOffset] [h: vTopEdgeY = vY - vYModCellSize + vYOffset] [h: vRightEdgeX = vLeftEdgeX + vCellSize] [h: vBottomEdgeY = vTopEdgeY + vCellSize] [h: ""] [h: vTopEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY))] [h: vRightEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vBottomEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vRightEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vLeftEdge = json.append("", json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vTopEdgeY), json.set("{}", "x", vLeftEdgeX, "y", vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vEdges = json.append("", vTopEdge, vRightEdge, vBottomEdge, vLeftEdge)] [h: ""] [h: vEdgeDistances = ""] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vY - vTopEdgeY))] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vX - vRightEdgeX))] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vY - vBottomEdgeY))] [h: vEdgeDistances = listAppend(vEdgeDistances, math.abs(vX - vLeftEdgeX))] [h: ""] [h: vClosestEdgeDistance = math.listMin(vEdgeDistances)] [h: vClosestEdgeIndex = listFind(vEdgeDistances, vClosestEdgeDistance)] [h: vClosestEdgeJSON = json.get(vEdges, vClosestEdgeIndex)] [h: ""] [h: vReturnJSON = json.set("{}", "distance", vClosestEdgeDistance, "points", vClosestEdgeJSON)] [h: return(0, vReturnJSON)]

macros.label: lineVBL
macros.command:
[h: vErrorMsg = 
	getMacroName() + " error: requires a single JSON array of 2 JSON point objects. Example: [{'x':0, 'y':0}, {'x':100,'y':0}]"]

[h, if(argCount() != 2): 		      assert(0, vErrorMsg)]
[h: vVBLPoints = arg(1)]
[h, if(json.type(vVBLPoints) != "ARRAY" || json.length(vVBLPoints) != 2): assert(0, vErrorMsg)]

[h: vVBLShape   = json.set("{}", "shape", "polygon", "close", 0, "points", vVBLPoints)]
[h: vVBLJSON    = json.append("", vVBLShape)]

[h: vMode = lower(arg(0))]
[h, if(vMode == "draw"):  drawVBL(vVBLJSON)]
[h, if(vMode == "erase"): eraseVBL(vVBLJSON)]

macros.label: getSimpleDoorPoints
macros.command: [h: ""] [h: vMapInfo = getInfo("map")] [h: vCellSize = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.size")] [h: vGridType = json.path.read(vMapInfo, "grid.type")] [h, if(vGridType != "Square"): log.error("Warning: SimpleDoors are only designed to work on maps with SQUARE grids!", "gm")] [h: ""] [h: vToken = currentToken()] [h, if(argCount() > 0): vToken = arg(0)] [h: vClosestEdge = simpleDoors.findClosestGridEdge()] [h: vClosestLine = simpleDoors.findClosestLine()] [h: vLineDistance = json.get(vClosestLine, "distance")] [h, if(vLineDistance != ""), code: { [if(vLineDistance <= vCellSize / 2): vClosestPoints = json.get(vClosestLine, "points"); vClosestPoints = json.get(vClosestEdge, "points")] };{ [vClosestPoints = json.get(vClosestEdge, "points")] }] [h: return(0, vClosestPoints)]

macros.label: exportLibJSON
macros.command:
[h, code: {
	[h: vPropsJSON = "{}"]
	[h, foreach(vProp, getPropertyNamesRaw(), ""): 
	vPropsJSON = json.set(vPropsJSON, vProp, getRawProperty(vProp))]

	[h: vMacrosJSON = ""]
	[h, foreach(vLabel, getMacros("json"), ""), code: {
    [foreach(vIndex, getMacroIndexes(vLabel), ""):
	  	vMacrosJSON = json.append(vMacrosJSON, getMacroProps(vIndex, "json"))]
	}]
	
	[h: vISOTime     = json.get(getInfo("Client"), "isoTimeDate")]
	[h: vTimeVersion = "0.0." + listget(replace(vISOTime, "[- :T]", ""), 0, ".")]
	
	[h: vLibVersion = getLibProperty("libVersion")]
	[h, if(vLibversion == ""):
		vLibVersion = vTimeVersion]
	[h: vJSON = json.set("{}", getName(), json.set("{}", vLibVersion,
		json.set("{}",
		"mtversion" , json.get(getInfo("client"), "version"),
		"notes"		, getNotes(),
		"gmnotes"	, getGMNotes(),
		"properties", vPropsJSON,
		"macros"	, vMacrosJSON)))]
}]

macros.label: List Libraries
macros.command: [macro("showFrame@" + libName): ""]
macros.tooltip: View and update this campaign's Library Tokens

macros.label: onCampaignLoad
macros.command:
[h: "<!-- Set a special function to indicate that OCL has run on this lib token. -->"]
[h: defineFunction("OCL." + getLibProperty("libOCL"), "onCampaignLoad@" + getMacroLocation())]

[h: "<!-- Set functions automatically in the the UDF group. -->"]
[h: vUDFGroup = "1.0 User Defined Functions"]
[h: vFunctionPrefix = "librat."]
[h, foreach(vMacroIndex, getMacroGroup(vUDFGroup)), code: {
	[vMacro = getStrProp(getMacroProps(vMacroIndex), "label")]
	[defineFunction(vFunctionPrefix + vMacro, vMacro + "@" + getMacroLocation())]
}]

[h: vJObjectProps = json.append("", 
	"jobj.HTTPresponses")]
[h, foreach(vJObjectProp, vJObjectProps), code: {
	[vType = json.type(getLibProperty(vJObjectProp))]
	[if(vType != "OBJECT"): setLibProperty(vJObjectProp, "{}")]
}]

macros.label: isValidURL
macros.command: [h: macro.return = matches(arg(0), '^(ftp|http|https):\/\/[^ "]+\$')]

macros.label: getUpdate
macros.command:
[h: assert(argCount(), "librat.getUpdate() Requires a single URL argument.")]
[h: vURL = arg(0)]

[h: vDataProp = "libData"]
[h: vJObject = getLibProperty(vDataProp)]
[h: setLibProperty(vDataProp, json.set(vJObject, vURL, "REST_TIMEOUT_OR_ERROR"))]

[h, if(librat.isValidURL(vURL) == 1):
	execlink(
		macroLinkText("tryREST@" + getMacroLocation(), 
		"none", 
		json.set("{}", "URL", vURL)), 1);
	setLibProperty(
		vDataProp, 
		json.set(vJObject, vURL, "INVALID_URL"))]

macros.label: Get Update JSON
macros.command:
[h: "<!-- Get all LibUpdateURL values -->"]
[h: vUpdateURLs = json.append("", getLibProperty("libDefaultUpdateURL"))]
[h: vLibInfo = librat.getLibs()]
[h: vLibNames = json.fields(vLibInfo, "json")]
[h, foreach(vLib, vLibNames), code: {
	[vURL = getLibProperty("libUpdateURL", vLib)]
	[if(vURL != ""): vUpdateURLs = json.append(vUpdateURLs, vURL)]
}]

[h: "<!-- Save last run's data and clear data property -->"]
[h, if(getLibProperty("libData") != "" && getLibProperty("libData") != "{}" ): 
	setLibProperty("libData.backup", getLibProperty("libData")]
[h: setLibProperty("libData"), "{}"]

[h: "<!-- Coordinate Deferred updates to JSON -->"]
[h, foreach(vURL, vUpdateURLs):
	execLink(macroLinkText("tryREST@" + libName), 1)]

[h: "<!-- Reload Libraries frame if present -->"]
[macro("List Libraries@" + getLibProperty("libName")]

macros.label: atoi
macros.tooltip: librat.atoi(string) returns the ASCII value of the first character of a string.

macros.label: tryREST
macros.command:
[h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")]
[h: vDataProp = "libData"]
[h: vJObject = getLibProperty(vDataProp)]
[h: vNewJObject = json.set(vJObject, vURL, REST.get(vURL, 0))]
[h: setLibProperty(vDataProp, vNewJObject)]
macros.tooltip:
Used by isValidRest() to determine valid REST URLs by setting JObject_Prop with the results of REST.get on REST_URL.

Usage: tryRest(REST_URL, JObject_Prop)

macros.label: showFrame
verifyREST
macros.command:
[h: json.toVars(macro.args, "v")]
[vJObject = getLibProperty(vJObjectProp)]
[vResponse = json.get(vJObject, vURL)]
[h, if(json.type(vResponse) != "OBJECT" 
    && vResponse != "REST_TIMEOUT" 
    && vResponse != "INVALID_URL"), code: 
	vNewJObject = json.set(vJObject, vURL, "INVALID_RESPONSE")]
[h, if(vNewJObject != vJObject): setLibProperty(vJObjectProp, vNewJObject)]
macros.tooltip:
Used by verifyREST to determine valid JSON Objects after tryREST.

Usage: tryRest(REST_URL, JObject_Prop)

macros.label: gtver
macros.command:
[h: "<!-- Set up debugging -->"]
[h: vDebugMsg = "librat.gtver: ")]

[h: "<!-- If the argument count is incorrect, take user input. -->"]
[h: log.debug(vDebugMsg + "argCount() == " + argCount())]
[h, if(argCount() == 2), code: {
	[vLeftArg     = replace(arg(0), "^[vV][a-zA-Z]*", "")]
	[vRightArg    = replace(arg(1), "^[vV][a-zA-Z]*", "")]
	[vClicked     = false]
};{
	[broadcast(vDebugMsg + "Detecting click context."))]			
	[abort(input("vLeftArg  | 1.4rc-2  | Left Version  | TEXT |",
	             "vRightArg | 1.4rc-1 | Right Version | TEXT |"))]
 	[vClicked = true]
}]

[h: "<!-- If the versions are equal, return false. -->"]
[h: log.debug(vDebugMsg + "Precheck - Comparing " + vLeftArg + " != " + vRightArg)]
[h: return(vLeftArg != vRightArg, 0)]

[h: "<!-- First check for 'BoT' style versions (45, 45a, 45b, 46, etc. -->"]
[h: vSimpleRegEx    = "^([0-9]+)([a-zA-Z]*)\$"]
[h: vSimpleLeftFID  = strfind(vLeftArg,  vSimpleRegEx)]
[h: vSimpleRightFID = strfind(vRightArg, vSimpleRegEx)]

[h, if(getFindCount(vSimpleLeftFID)  == 1 && 
       getFindCount(vSimpleRightFID) == 1), code: {
         [h: "<!-- Check numbers first -->"]
         [vLeft  = number(getGroup(vSimpleLeftFID,  1, 1))]
         [vRight = number(getGroup(vSimpleRightFID, 1, 1))]
         [if(vLeft != vRight), code:{
         	 [if(vClicked): broadcast(vDebugMsg + "" + (vLeft > vRight))]
		     [log.debug(vDebugMsg + "SimpleVer - Comparing " + vLeft + ", " + vRight)]         	 
             [return(0, vLeft > vRight)]
         }]
             
         [h: "<!-- No luck? Then check letters -->"]
         [vLeft  = librat.atoi(getGroup(vSimpleLeftFID,  1, 2))]
         [vRight = librat.atoi(getGroup(vSimpleRightFID, 1, 2))]
     	 [if(vClicked): broadcast(vDebugMsg + (vLeft > vRight))]
	     [log.debug(vDebugMsg + "SimpleVer - Comparing " + vLeft + ", " + vRight)]
         [return(0, vLeft > vRight)]
}]

[h: "<!-- Next try Semver-ish check, 1.12.1 > 1.12 > 1.12rc-2 > 1.1a, etc -->"]
[h: vRegEx    = "[^0-9a-zA-Z]*([0-9]*)[^.0-9a-zA-Z]*([a-zA-Z]*)[^.0-9a-zA-Z]*([0-9]*)"]
[h: vGroups   = 3]
[h: vLeftFID  = strfind(vLeftArg,  vRegEx)]
[h: vRightFID = strfind(vRightArg, vRegEx)]

[h: vLeftMatches  = getFindCount(vLeftFID) ]
[h: vRightMatches = getFindCount(vRightFID)]
[h: vMatches      = min(vLeftMatches, vRightMatches)]

[h, for(vMatch, 1, vMatches), code: {
	[for(vGroup, 1, vGroups + 1), code: {
		[log.debug(vDebugMsg + "SemVer - Match: " + vMatch + ", Group: " + vGroup]
		[vLeft  = getGroup(vLeftFID,  vMatch, vGroup)]
		[vRight = getGroup(vRightFID, vMatch, vGroup)]
		[log.debug(vDebugMsg + "SemVer - Comparing " + vLeft + ", " + vRight)]
		[if(vGroup == 2): log.debug(vDebugMsg + "SemVer - post atoi: " + vLeft + ", " + vRight)]
		[if(vGroup == 2): vLeft  = librat.atoi.semver(vLeft )]
		[if(vGroup == 2): vRight = librat.atoi.semver(vRight)]
		
		[if(vLeft != vRight && vClicked == true):
			broadcast(vDebugMsg + (vLeft > vRight))]	    
	    [if(vLeft != vRight): return(0, vLeft > vRight)]
	}]
}]

[h: "<!-- In a tie, return 1 if left side has more version number matches -->"]
[if(vClicked): 
	broadcast(vDebugMsg + vLeftMatches > vRightMatches)]
[h: log.debug(vDebugMsg + "Fallback Match Number Comparison - Comparing " + vLeftMatches + ", " + vRightMatches)]
[h: return(0, vLeftMatches > vRightMatches)]
macros.tooltip: gtver(version1, version2) returns 1 if version1 is > version2, else 0.

macros.label: showChatProgress
macros.command: [h: vPercent = arg(0)] [h: vTaskName = arg(1)] [h, if(argCount() > 2): vTaskNote = arg(2); vTaskNote = ""] [h: vSteps = 20] [h: vStep = 100 / vSteps] [h: vProgressBar = ""] [h, count(vSteps): vProgressBar = vProgressBar + if(roll.count * vStep <= vPercent * 100, "*", ".")] [h, if(vPercent < vStep / 100): vPercentSign = "% "; vPercentSign = if(vPercent == 1, "% ", "% ")] [h: vProgressMsg = vTaskName + ": [" + vProgressBar + "] " + floor(vPercent * 100) + vPercentSign + "" + vTaskNote] [h: broadcast(vProgressMsg, "gm")]
macros.tooltip: showChatProgress(percent, taskName [, taskNote]) broadcasts a progress bar in chat to GMs.

macros.label: getLibs
macros.command: [h: macro.return = json.get(getInfo("client"), "library tokens")]
macros.tooltip: librat.getLibs() returns the getInfo() library token JSON to the calling macro.

macros.label: getTestJSON
atoi.semver
macros.tooltip: atoi.semver(versionAlpha) converts alpha characters to an integer such that "" > rc > b > a etc.

macros.label: gtver.tst
macros.command:
[h: vTestJSON = json.append("", 
	json.append("", "1", "1", 0),
	json.append("", "48b", "48b", 0),
	json.append("", "2.0rc-1", "2.0rc-1", 0),	
	json.append("", "v1.2b-3", "Ver2.0", 0),
	json.append("", "Ver2.0", "v1.2b-3", 1),	
	json.append("", "45", "45d", 0),	
	json.append("", "-5", "2", 1),
	json.append("", "2", "-5", 0),
	json.append("", "0.5b", "0.5", 0),
	json.append("", "0.5", "0.5b", 1),
	json.append("", "45d", "45", 1),
	json.append("", "45", "45d", 0),
	json.append("", "1.8.5rc-1", "1.8.5rc-2", 0),
	json.append("", "1.8.5rc-2", "1.8.5rc-1", 1))]

[h: vTestNum = 0]
[h, foreach(vTest, vTestJSON), code: {
	[vArg0           = json.get(vTest, 0)]
	[vArg1           = json.get(vTest, 1)]	
	[vExpectedOutput = json.get(vTest, 2)]
	[vActualOutput   = librat.gtver(vArg0, vArg1)]
	[if(vExpectedOutput == vActualOutput), code: {	
		[vResultColor = "blue"]
		[vResultMsg   = "Success"]		
	};{
		[vResultColor = "red"]
		[vResultMsg   = "Error, expected " + vExpectedOutput]		
	}]
	[vTestNum = vTestNum + 1]
	[broadcast( strformat("<tt style='color:%{vResultColor}'>%{vTestNum}| Testing librat.gtver(%{vArg0}, %{vArg1}) - %{vResultMsg}: %{vActualOutput}</tt>"))]
}]

macros.label: exportLibJSON
macros.command:
[h: vLibsJSON = "{}"]
[h: vLibs     = librat.getLibs()]
[h: vLibTotal = json.length(vLibs)]
[h: vLibNum   = 0]
[h, foreach(vLib, vLibs), code: {
	[librat.showChatProgress(vLibNum / vLibTotal, "Compiling Library JSON for Export", getName(vLib))]
	[vPropsJSON = "{}"]
	[foreach(vProp, getPropertyNamesRaw("json", vLib), ""): 
		vPropsJSON = json.set(vPropsJSON, vProp, getRawProperty(vProp, vLib))]

	[vMacrosJSON = ""]
	[foreach(vLabel, getMacros("json", vLib), ""), code: {
	    [foreach(vIndex, getMacroIndexes(vLabel, "json", vLib), ""):
		  	vMacrosJSON = json.append(vMacrosJSON, getMacroProps(vIndex, "json", vLib))]
		}]
	
	[vLibVersion = getLibProperty("libVersion", vLib)]
	[vISOTimeDate = json.get(getInfo("Client"), "isoTimeDate")]
	[if(vLibversion == ""):
		vLibVersion = "Unknown." + vISOTimeDate]
	[vLibsJSON = json.set(vLibsJSON, getName(vLib), json.set("{}", 
		vLibVersion,	json.set("{}",
			"mtversion" , json.get(getInfo("client"), "version"),
			"timestamp" , vISOTimeDate,
			"notes"		, getNotes(vLib),
			"gmnotes"	, getGMNotes(vLib),
			"properties", vPropsJSON,
			"macros"	, vMacrosJSON)))]
    [vLibNum = vLibNum + 1]
}]
[h: librat.showChatProgress(vLibNum / vLibTotal, "Compiling Library JSON for Export", "Done!")]

        "Standard Trap":         {
          "index": 8,
          "fontColor": "black",

          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [
            "group",
            "sortPrefix",

            "includeLabel",
            "autoExecute",
            "applyToSelected"
          ],
          "command": "[h:'<!----------------------------- Standard Trap -------------------------------->']\n<!-- Here you enter the code to apply the effect of the TRAP Example is given -->\n<!-- NOTE THAT ALL OUTPUT IS IGNORED, SO THE ONLY WAY TO GET SOMETHING TO THE CHAT IS BY USING BROADCAST! -->\n\n[h:me = arg(0)]\n[h:event = arg(1)]\n[h:triggerType = arg(5)]\n\n<!-- assert that the trigger is a pad event -->\n[h:assert(triggerType == \"pad\" || triggerType == \"area\", \"The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: <i>\"+triggerType+\"<\/i> to this pad\", 0)]\n\n[h:switchToken(me)]\n[h:attackRoll = d20]\n[h:roll=1d6]\n[h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity):HP=HP-roll]\n[h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity):broadcast(\"You have triggered a trap and sustained \"+roll+\" hits.<br>\")]",
          "label": "Standard Trap",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",
          "group": "pad events",
          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },
        "Red Team Teleport":         {
          "index": 11,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",
          "sortBy": "",
          "minWidth": "90",
          "color": "default",
          "playerEditable": true,
          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [

            "includeLabel",
            "autoExecute",
            "applyToSelected"
          ],
          "command": "[h:bot_execAssignPads(1, 'Red')]",
          "label": "Red Team Teleport",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",

          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },
        "Standard Pit":         {
          "index": 19,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",
          "sortBy": "",
          "minWidth": "90",
          "color": "default",
          "playerEditable": false,
          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [
            "group",
            "sortPrefix",
            "command",
            "includeLabel",
            "autoExecute",
            "applyToSelected"
          ],
          "command": "[h:'<!-----------------------------Standard Pit (trapped)---------------------------------->']\n<!-- Here you enter the code to apply the effect of the pit Example is given -->\n<!-- NOTE THAT ALL OUTPUT IS IGNORED, SO THE ONLY WAY TO GET SOMETHING TO THE CHAT IS BY USING BROADCAST! -->\n\n<!-- check which event this token triggers this can be \n- movedOn \n- movedOff \n- movedOver \n- movedReturn\twhen you move the token AND use way points AND leave the token but end the move onto the token\n-->\n\n[h:me\t\t\t\t\t= arg(0)]\n[h:event\t\t\t\t= arg(1)]\n[h:padName\t\t\t\t= arg(2)]\n[h:lastPath \t\t\t= arg(3)]\n[h:eventPadTriggered\t= arg(4)]\n[h:triggerType\t\t\t= arg(5)]\n\n<!-- assert that the trigger is a pad event -->\n[h:assert(triggerType == \"pad\", \"The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: <i>\"+triggerType+\"<\/i> to this pad\", 0)]\n\n[h:switchToken(me)]\n[h:trapped = if(event==\"movedOff\" || event==\"movedReturn\",1,0)]\n\n[h:attackRoll = 1d20]\n[h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity), CODE:{\n\t[h:'<!--Failed Ag Test-->']\n\t[h:entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)]\n\t[h:x = json.get(entryPoint, \"x\")]\n\t[h:y = json.get(entryPoint, \"y\")]\n\t[h:iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)]\n\t[h:lastPath = if(trapped, json.get(lastPath, 0, 0), json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1) )]\n\n\t[h, token(padName): setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())]\n\t[h: moveToken(x, y)]\n\t[h: txtOut = if(trapped,\"You failed to climb out<br>\",\"you've fallen into a pit<br>\")]\n\t[h: AgTest = \"Failed\"]\n}; {\n\t[h:'<!--Succeeded Ag Test-->']\n\t[h: txtOut = if(trapped,\"You succeed to climb out<br>\", \"You nearly fell into a pit, but succeeded your Ag test. Rethink your next move!!<br>\")]\n\t[h: AgTest = \"Success\"]\n\n\t[h:'<!-- if you move into (and not over) the pit and succeed your Ag check, you are pushed back to the edge of the pit. This means that a player cannot move into a pit voluntarily -->']\n\t[h, if(event == \"movedOn\"), CODE: {\n\t\t[entryPoint\t\t= json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)]\n\t\t[iEntryPoint\t= json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)]\n\t\t[edgePoint\t\t=  json.get(lastPath, iEntryPoint-1)]\n\t\t[lastPath\t\t=  json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1)]\n\t\t\n\t\t[x\t\t\t\t= json.get(edgePoint, \"x\")]\n\t\t[y\t\t\t\t= json.get(edgePoint, \"y\")]\n\t\t[moveToken(x, y)]\n\t}]\n}]\n[h:broadcast(txtOut)]\n[h:macro.return = lastPath]",
          "label": "Standard Pit",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",
          "group": "pad events",
          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },
        "Limit Movement":         {
          "index": 6,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",
          "sortBy": "",
          "minWidth": "90",
          "color": "default",
          "playerEditable": false,
          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [
            "group",
            "sortPrefix",
            "command",
            "includeLabel",
            "autoExecute",
            "applyToSelected"
          ],
          "command": "[h:'<!-- limitMovementMacro --> <!-- IGNORE OUTPUT , NO NEW SCOPE-->']\n[h:\"<!-- \n\tThis macro is run if the limitMovement variable is set <> 0 in the settings (toggles) and it handles the movement limitation and it \n\twill ONLY run if Limit Movement (in the settings-->toggles) is set to a number other then 0. The below macro handles movement \n\tlimitation in a very basic form. You can choose to change this to handle more advanced movement limitations. \n\n\tIt uses the same scope as the onTokenMove macro, which means that you have certain variables at your disposal:\n\t- limitMovement: is the max amount the token is allowed to move.\n\t- lastPath: an array of coordinates of the path over which the token has moved\n\t- startingLocation: the coordinates where the token started (in the form of an array)\n\t- currentLocation: the coordinates where the token ended (in the form of an array)\n\t- usedMove: the amount of cells moved (getMoveCount())\n\t\n\tAn example:\n\tLets say that all the tokens have a characteristic: Dexterity and the max amount of cells a token is allowed to move is 4 x Dexterity. \n\tIn addition if a token is Dead or Incapacitated, it cannot move. Lets say that these conditions are set with states in your framework.\n\tThen you could add this piece of code in front of the if() in the macro. \n\t\n\t[h,if(getState('Dead') || getState('Incapacitated'), CODE:{\t\n\t\t[limitMovement = 0]\t\n\t\t[message\t= '%{tok} is incapacitated and cannot move']\n\t}; {\t\n\t\t[limitMovement = 4*Dexterity]\n\t}]\n-->\"]\n\n[tok \t\t\t= getSelectedNames()]\n[if(listCount(tok) > 1), CODE:{\n\t<!-- multiple tokens are moved -->\n\t<!-- get first token from list of selected tokens and make that token current token -->\n\t[tok = listGet(tok, 0)]\n\t[switchToken(tok)]\n\t<!-- because of multiple selected tokens, just check if the initpanel is in use -->\n\t[initInUse\t= !json.isEmpty(json.get(getInitiativeList(),\"tokens\"))]\n\t<!-- variable to check if a single token is moved or multiple -->\n\t[singleMove = 0]\n}; {\n\t<!-- single token is moved -->\n\t<!-- if only one token is moved, check if its in the init panel -->\n\t[initInUse\t\t= if(getInitiative() != \"The token is not in the initiative list.\", 1, 0)]\n\t[singleMove = 1]\n}]\n\n<!-- limit movement AREAS -->\n<!-- note that all these text outputs will be ignored. Im leaving them here for reference -->\n[h: linkedAreas = getLibProperty(\"linkedAreas\", \"lib:EventMacros\")]\n[h,if(json.contains(linkedAreas, map+\".W42.Limit\")), CODE:{\n\t[thisMapLimits\t\t\t= json.get(linkedAreas, map+\".W42.Limit\")]\n\t[ignoreStartPath\t\t= json.remove(lastPath,0)]\n\t[thisMapAreas\t\t\t= json.get(getLibProperty(\"storedAreas\",\"lib:EventMacros\"),map)]\n\t[DpC\t\t\t\t\t= json.get(json.get(getInfo(\"map\"),\"grid\"),\"units per cell\")]\n\n\t[h:output = strformat(\n\t\t\"<b><u>MOVE ACTION OF %{token.name}<\/u><\/b><br>\n\t\tAreas Checked: %s<br>\n\t\tStart coord: %{startingLocation}, Current coord: %{currentLocation}<br>\n\t\tYou moved: %{usedMove}<br><br>\", json.fields(thisMapLimits)\n\t)]\n\n\t[foreach(areaName, thisMapLimits,\"<br>\"), CODE:{\n\t\t[h:areaCoords\t\t\t= json.get(thisMapAreas, areaName)]\n\t\t[h:intersectPath\t\t= json.intersection(ignoreStartPath,areaCoords)]\n\t\t[h:eventPadTriggered\t= json.intersection(lastPath,areaCoords)]\n\t\t[h:diffCount\t\t\t= json.length(intersectPath)*DpC]\n\t\t[h:modifier\t\t\t\t= if(areaName == \"Very Difficult Terrain\", 2, 1)]\n\t\t[h:totalDiff\t\t\t\t= diffCount*modifier]\n\t\t[h:usedMove\t\t\t\t= usedMove + totalDiff]\n\t\t\n\t\t[h:output = output + strformat(\n\t\t\t\"<b>Area: %{areaName}<\/b>\n\t\t\toverlap with last path: %{intersectPath}<br>\n\t\t\tTrigger Type: %s<br>\n\t\t\tYou moved %{diffCount} (+%{totalDiff} move) over %{areaName}<br>\", bot_getEventType()\n\t\t)]\n\t}]\n\n\t[h:output = output + strformat(\"In total you moved: %{usedMove}\")]\n[broadcast(output)]\n}]\n\n[message\t\t= \"You moved <i>%{tok}<\/i> <b>%{usedMove}<\/b> cells. The maximum allowed movement is <b>%{limitMovement}<\/b> cells.\"]\n[if( !isGM() && initInUse && usedMove && usedMove > limitMovement), CODE:{\n\t<!-- only limit movement if: mover is not the gm, token is in initiative panel, the token has actually moved AND it has moved more then the allowed amount-->\n\t[broadcast(strformat(message))]\n\t<!-- The following code you should not touch as its used for onTokenMove to process the rest. -->\n\t[tokens.denyMove\t= 1]\n\t[doAbort\t\t\t= 1]\n\t[resetMove\t\t\t= 1]\n\t[lastPath\t\t\t= \"[]\"]\n\t[if(singleMove): currentLocation\t= startingLocation]\n}; {}]",
          "label": "Limit Movement",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",
          "group": "CORE",
          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },
        "onCampaignLoad":         {
          "index": 5,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",
          "sortBy": "1",
          "minWidth": "90",
          "color": "yellow",
          "playerEditable": false,
          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [
            "group",

          ],
          "command": "[H:'\n<!-- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -->\n<!-- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----ONCAMPAIGNLOAD LIB:EVENTMACROS ----------------- -->\n<!-- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -->']\n\n[H: '<!-- defineFunction(function, macro, ignoreOutput, newScope) -->']\n\n[h:prefix = \"bot_\"]\n\n[h:defineFunction(prefix+\"limitMovement\", \"Limit Movement@this\" ,1,0) ]",
          "label": "onCampaignLoad",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",
          "group": "CORE",
          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },

          "index": 18,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",

          "color": "default",

          ],
          "command": "[h:'<!-----------------------------Standard Net Trap (tripwire)---------------------------------->']\n<!-- Here you enter the code to apply the effect of the pit Example is given -->\n<!-- NOTE THAT ALL OUTPUT IS IGNORED, SO THE ONLY WAY TO GET SOMETHING TO THE CHAT IS BY USING BROADCAST! -->\n\n<!-- check which event this token triggers this can be \n- movedOn \n- movedOver \n-->\n\n[h:me\t\t\t\t\t= arg(0)]\n[h:event\t\t\t\t= arg(1)]\n[h:padName\t\t\t\t= arg(2)]\n[h:lastPath \t\t\t= arg(3)]\n[h:eventPadTriggered\t= arg(4)]\n[h:triggerType\t\t\t= arg(5)]\n\n[h:netTrapPad\t\t\t= \"net trap 1\"]\n\n<!-- assert that the trigger is a pad event -->\n[h:assert(triggerType == \"pad\", \"The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: <i>\"+triggerType+\"<\/i> to this pad\", 0)]\n\n[h:switchToken(me)]\n[h:trapped = if(event==\"movedOff\" || event==\"movedReturn\",1,0)]\n\n[h:attackRoll = 1d20]\n[h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity), CODE:{\n\t[h:'<!--Failed Ag Test-->']\n\t[h:entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)]\n\t[h:x = json.get(entryPoint, \"x\")]\n\t[h:y = json.get(entryPoint, \"y\")]\n\t[h:iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)]\n\t[h:lastPath = if(trapped, json.get(lastPath, 0, 0), json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1) )]\n\n\t[h, token(netTrapPad): setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())]\n\t[h: moveToken(x, y)]\n\t[h: txtOut = if(trapped,\"You failed to climb out<br>\",\"you've triggered a net trap<br>\")]\n\t[h: AgTest = \"Failed\"]\n\t[h: setState('Trapped', 1, me)]\n}; {\n\t[h:'<!--Succeeded Ag Test-->']\n\t[h: txtOut = if(trapped,\"You succeed to climb out<br>\", \"You nearly triggered a trip wire, but succeeded your Ag test. Rethink your next move!!<br>\")]\n\t[h: AgTest = \"Success\"]\n\t[h: setState('Trapped', 0, me)]\n\n\t[h:'<!-- if you move onto (and not over) the tripwire and succeed your Ag check, you are pushed back to the edge of the tripwire. This means that a player cannot move onto a tripwire  voluntarily -->']\n\t[h, if(event == \"movedOn\"), CODE: {\n\t\t[entryPoint\t\t= json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)]\n\t\t[iEntryPoint\t= json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)]\n\t\t[edgePoint\t\t= json.get(lastPath, iEntryPoint-1)]\n\t\t[lastPath\t\t= json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1)]\n\t\t\n\t\t[x\t\t\t\t= json.get(edgePoint, \"x\")]\n\t\t[y\t\t\t\t= json.get(edgePoint, \"y\")]\n\t\t[moveToken(x, y)]\n\t}]\n}]\n[h:broadcast(txtOut)]\n[h:macro.return = lastPath]",
          "label": "Standard Net Trap",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",

          "tooltip": ""

You can choose to change this to handle more advanced movement limitations. \n\n\tIt uses the same scope as the onTokenMove macro, which means that you have certain variables at your disposal:\n\t- limitMovement: is the max amount the token is allowed to move.\n\t- lastPath: an array of coordinates of the path over which the token has moved\n\t- startingLocation: the coordinates where the token started (in the form of an array)\n\t- currentLocation: the coordinates where the token ended (in the form of an array)\n\t- usedMove: the amount of cells moved (getMoveCount())\n\t\n\tAn example:\n\tLets say that all the tokens have a characteristic: Dexterity and the max amount of cells a token is allowed to move is 4 x Dexterity. \n\tIn addition if a token is Dead or Incapacitated, it cannot move. Lets say that these conditions are set with states in your framework.\n\tThen you could add this piece of code in front of the if() in the macro. \n\t\n\t[h,if(getState('Dead') || getState('Incapacitated'), CODE:{\t\n\t\t[limitMovement = 0]\t\n\t\t[message\t= '%{tok} is incapacitated and cannot move']\n\t}; {\t\n\t\t[limitMovement = 4*Dexterity]\n\t}]\n-->\"]\n\n[tok \t\t\t= getSelectedNames()]\n[if(listCount(tok) > 1), CODE:{\n\t<!-- multiple tokens are moved -->\n\t<!-- get first token from list of selected tokens and make that token current token -->\n\t[tok = listGet(tok, 0)]\n\t[switchToken(tok)]\n\t<!-- because of multiple selected tokens, just check if the initpanel is in use -->\n\t[initInUse\t= !json.isEmpty(json.get(getInitiativeList(),\"tokens\"))]\n\t<!-- variable to check if a single token is moved or multiple -->\n\t[singleMove = 0]\n}; {\n\t<!-- single token is moved -->\n\t<!-- if only one token is moved, check if its in the init panel -->\n\t[initInUse\t\t= if(getInitiative() != \"The token is not in the initiative list.\", 1, 0)]\n\t[singleMove = 1]\n}]\n\n<!-- limit movement AREAS -->\n<!-- note that all these text outputs will be ignored. Im leaving them here for reference -->\n[h: linkedAreas = getLibProperty(\"linkedAreas\", \"lib:EventMacros\")]\n[h,if(json.contains(linkedAreas, map+\".W42.Limit\")), CODE:{\n\t[thisMapLimits\t\t\t= json.get(linkedAreas, map+\".W42.Limit\")]\n\t[ignoreStartPath\t\t= json.remove(lastPath,0)]\n\t[thisMapAreas\t\t\t= json.get(getLibProperty(\"storedAreas\",\"lib:EventMacros\"),map)]\n\t[DpC\t\t\t\t\t= json.get(json.get(getInfo(\"map\"),\"grid\"),\"units per cell\")]\n\n\t[h:output = strformat(\n\t\t\"<b><u>MOVE ACTION OF %{token.name}<\/u><\/b><br>\n\t\tAreas Checked: %s<br>\n\t\tStart coord: %{startingLocation}, Current coord: %{currentLocation}<br>\n\t\tYou moved: %{usedMove}<br><br>\", json.fields(thisMapLimits)\n\t)]\n\n\t[foreach(areaName, thisMapLimits,\"<br>\"), CODE:{\n\t\t[h:areaCoords\t\t\t= json.get(thisMapAreas, areaName)]\n\t\t[h:intersectPath\t\t= json.intersection(ignoreStartPath,areaCoords)]\n\t\t[h:eventPadTriggered\t= json.intersection(lastPath,areaCoords)]\n\t\t[h:diffCount\t\t\t= json.length(intersectPath)*DpC]\n\t\t[h:modifier\t\t\t\t= if(areaName == \"Very Difficult Terrain\", 2, 1)]\n\t\t[h:totalDiff\t\t\t\t= diffCount*modifier]\n\t\t[h:usedMove\t\t\t\t= usedMove + totalDiff]\n\t\t\n\t\t[h:output = output + strformat(\n\t\t\t\"<b>Area: %{areaName}<\/b>\n\t\t\toverlap with last path: %{intersectPath}<br>\n\t\t\tTrigger Type: %s<br>\n\t\t\tYou moved %{diffCount} (+%{totalDiff} move) over %{areaName}<br>\", bot_getEventType()\n\t\t)]\n\t}]\n\n\t[h:output = output + strformat(\"In total you moved: %{usedMove}\")]\n[broadcast(output)]\n}]\n\n[message\t\t= \"You moved <i>%{tok}<\/i> <b>%{usedMove}<\/b> cells. The maximum allowed movement is <b>%{limitMovement}<\/b> cells.\"]\n[if( !isGM() && initInUse && usedMove && usedMove > limitMovement), CODE:{\n\t<!-- only limit movement if: mover is not the gm, token is in initiative panel, the token has actually moved AND it has moved more then the allowed amount-->\n\t[broadcast(strformat(message))]\n\t<!-- The following code you should not touch as its used for onTokenMove to process the rest. -->\n\t[tokens.denyMove\t= 1]\n\t[doAbort\t\t\t= 1]\n\t[resetMove\t\t\t= 1]\n\t[lastPath\t\t\t= \"[]\"]\n\t[if(singleMove): currentLocation\t= startingLocation]\n}; {}]",

        "Limit Sight":         {
          "index": 3,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",
          "sortBy": "",
          "minWidth": "90",
          "color": "default",
          "playerEditable": false,
          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [
            "group",
            "sortPrefix",
            "command",
            "includeLabel",
            "autoExecute",
            "applyToSelected"
          ],
          "command": "[h:'<!----------------------------- Limit Sight -------------------------------->']\n[h:'<!-- check which event type this token triggers this can be \n- movedOn \n- movedOff \nLimited 1: circle distance=7,5 \nLimited 2: circle distance=3,5 \nLimited 3: circle distance=5,5 \nLimited 4: circle distance=1,5 \n-->']\n[h:me\t\t\t= arg(0)]\n[h:event\t\t= arg(1)]\n\n[h:triggerType\t\t\t= arg(5)]\n\n<!-- assert that the trigger is a pad or area event -->\n[h:assert(triggerType == \"pad\" || triggerType == \"area\", \"The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: <i>\"+triggerType+\"<\/i> to this pad\", 0)]\n\n[h:switchToken(me)]\n\n<!-- first retrieve the current sight level, is none is set, then set to 0 -->\n[h:\t\t\t\t\t\tsightLevel = getProperty(\"w42.bot.sightLevel\")]\n[h,if(sightLevel == \"\"):\tsightLevel = 0]\n\n<!-- get current sight type. If this is NOT a limited sight, then its the original sight so store this on the token so it can be retrieved later when the tokens steps off the EventPad(s) -->\n[h:sightType = getSightType()]\n[h,if(!startsWith(sightType, \"Limited \")):setProperty(\"w42.bot.oldSightType\", sightType)]\n\n<!-- For each extra EventToken (that contains this macro) the token is standing on increase the level. If the token moves off the eventPads, decrease the level. E.g. if a token moves onto 4 stacked event pads that run this macro, then this macro will run four times in a row, each time increasing the sight level with one step upto sight level 4. If the token then moves off one, but remains on three others, the sight level is decreased by 1-->\n<!-- also make sure that the value is always between 0 and 4 -->\n[h,if(event == \"movedOn\"):\tsightLevel = min(4,sightLevel + 1)]\n[h,if(event == \"movedOff\"):\tsightLevel = max(0,sightLevel - 1)]\n\n<!-- finally depending on the sight level (where 0==original sight type set the sight type of the token -->\n[h:setProperty(\"w42.bot.sightLevel\", sightLevel)]\n[h, if(sightLevel):setSightType(\"Limited \"+sightLevel); setSightType(getProperty(\"w42.bot.oldSightType\"))]",
          "label": "Limit Sight",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",
          "group": "pad events",
          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },

        "Typical Door":         {
          "index": 9,
          "fontColor": "black",
          "maxWith": "",
          "sortBy": "",
          "minWidth": "90",
          "color": "default",
          "playerEditable": false,
          "includeLabel": false,
          "compare":           [
            "group",
            "sortPrefix",
            "command",
            "includeLabel",
            "autoExecute",
            "applyToSelected"
          ],
          "command": "[h:'<!-----------------------------Standard Door Event---------------------------------->']\n[h:'<!--Here you enter the code to that effects the token that operates the door-->']\n\n[h:'<!-- \n- \"tokList\" is a list of tokens that are in the vicinity of the door when its operated. The first in the list are the tokens owned by the user that operated the door\n- \"users\" is a list of users where the first in the list is the user that operated the door, the rest of the list are users that own tokens that are in the vicinity\n- \"door\" is the name of the door that is operated\n- \"doorIsopened\" is true (1) when the player opens the door and false (0) when the player closed the door\n- \"isLocked\" is true (1) when the door has the \"Locked\" state and false (0) when it has not.\n- \"triggerType\" is always \"door\" this to prevent accidentily assigning the wrong eventtypes to a trigger\n-->']\n\n[h:me\t\t\t\t\t= arg(0)]\n[h:thisPlayer\t\t\t= arg(1)]\n[h:tokList\t\t\t\t= arg(2)]\n[h:byStanders\t\t\t= arg(3)]\n[h:door\t\t\t\t\t= arg(4)]\n[h:triggerType\t\t\t= arg(5)]\n[h:doorIsOpened\t\t\t= arg(6)]\n[h:isLocked\t\t\t\t= arg(7)]\n\n<!-- assert that the trigger is a door event -->\n[h:assert(triggerType == \"door\", \"The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: <i>\"+triggerType+\"<\/i> to door: \"+door, 0)]\n\n<!-- make operating token currentToken -->\n[h:switchToken(me)]\n\n<!-- THIS IS THE PART THAT YOU MOST LIKELY WANT TO EDIT -->\n<!-- BROADCAST IS THE ONLY WAY TO CONVEY A MESSAGE TO THE CHAT-->\n[h, if(isLocked), CODE:{\n\t<!-- this is executed when someone tries to open the door but its locked -->\n\n\t<!-- this is send to the operator -->\n\t[broadcast(\"You try to open the door but it won't budge, perhaps its locked?\",thisPlayer)]\n\n\t<!-- this is send to the bystanders -->\n\t[broadcast(me+\" tries to open the door but it appears to be locked\",byStanders)]\n\t\n\t<!-- if the door is locked AND you send something to the chat, than you need to abort here. Else its done in the core function and another message is send to the chat. -->\n\t[abort(0)]\n}; {\n\t<!-- this is executed when someone opens or closes the door-->\n\t<!-- to the operator -->\n\t[if(doorIsOpened): broadcast(\"The door makes a loud 'SQUEEEEEK' noise when you open the door\", thisPlayer); broadcast(\"You close the door with an audible 'CLICK' \", thisPlayer)]\n\t<!-- to the bystanders -->\n\t[if(doorIsOpened): broadcast(\"With a loud 'SQUEEEEEK' the door opens\", byStanders); broadcast(\"The door closes with an audible 'CLICK' \", byStanders)]\n}]",
          "label": "Typical Door",
          "applyToSelected": false,
          "fontSize": "1.00em",
          "group": "door events",
          "autoExecute": true,
          "tooltip": ""
        },

            {
        "autoExecute": true,
        "color": "default",
        "fontColor": "black",
        "group": "Event Pad Macros",
        "includeLabel": false,
        "sortBy": "",
        "index": 3,
        "label": "Limit Sight",
        "fontSize": "1.00em",
        "minWidth": "90",
        "playerEditable": false,
        "command": "[h:'<!----------------------------- Limit Sight -------------------------------->']\n[h:'<!-- check which event type this token triggers this can be \n- movedOn \n- movedOff \nLimited 1: circle distance=7,5 \nLimited 2: circle distance=3,5 \nLimited 3: circle distance=5,5 \nLimited 4: circle distance=1,5 \n-->']\n[h:me\t\t\t= arg(0)]\n[h:event\t\t= arg(1)]\n\n[h:triggerType\t\t\t= arg(5)]\n\n<!-- assert that the trigger is a pad or area event -->\n[h:assert(triggerType == \"pad\" || triggerType == \"area\", \"The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: <i>\"+triggerType+\"<\/i> to this pad\", 0)]\n\n[h:switchToken(me)]\n\n<!-- first retrieve the current sight level, is none is set, then set to 0 -->\n[h:\t\t\t\t\t\tsightLevel = getProperty(\"w42.bot.sightLevel\")]\n[h,if(sightLevel == \"\"):\tsightLevel = 0]\n\n<!-- get current sight type. If this is NOT a limited sight, then its the original sight so store this on the token so it can be retrieved later when the tokens steps off the EventPad(s) -->\n[h:sightType = getSightType()]\n[h,if(!startsWith(sightType, \"Limited \")):setProperty(\"w42.bot.oldSightType\", sightType)]\n\n<!-- For each extra EventToken (that contains this macro) the token is standing on increase the level. If the token moves off the eventPads, decrease the level. E.g. if a token moves onto 4 stacked event pads that run this macro, then this macro will run four times in a row, each time increasing the sight level with one step upto sight level 4. If the token then moves off one, but remains on three others, the sight level is decreased by 1-->\n<!-- also make sure that the value is always between 0 and 4 -->\n[h,if(event == \"movedOn\"):\tsightLevel = min(4,sightLevel + 1)]\n[h,if(event == \"movedOff\"):\tsightLevel = max(0,sightLevel - 1)]\n\n<!-- finally depending on the sight level (where 0==original sight type set the sight type of the token -->\n[h:setProperty(\"w42.bot.sightLevel\", sightLevel)]\n[h, if(sightLevel):setSightType(\"Limited \"+sightLevel); setSightType(getProperty(\"w42.bot.oldSightType\"))]",
        "maxWidth": "",
        "tooltip": "",
        "applyToSelected": false,
        "compare":         [
          "group",
          "sortPrefix",
          "command",
          "includeLabel",
          "autoExecute",
          "applyToSelected"
        ],
